result.execSummary:
The defendant Darla Louise Scheel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
All court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collectin by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9); also advised that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by: ETHEL F.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THIRTY-THREE (33) MONTHS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED SIXTY-ONE (161) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is EIGHTEEN (18) MONTHS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Consecutive to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9).  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Br. 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Darla Louise Scheel in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

BRANCH 28 HELD IN BRANCH 26.  Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Darla Louise Scheel not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   ENTRY MADE NO FILE IN COURT.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date pending defendant's acceptance into another court.  No objection from the state.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 28.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court sets bail at $750 cash.  All other conditions of bail to remain as previously set.

Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.
